utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Checkmate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: O-o-o-o-h! Again?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Obviously you’re not well suited for three-dimensional chess, perhaps three dimensional candyland would be more your speed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just reset the board.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It must be humbling to suck on so many different levels.

utterance.speaker: Penny (knocking and entering)
utterance.content: Hi guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did you get my mail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, right here. How was Nebraska?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, better than North Dakota! I guess that joke’s only funny in Nebraska.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: From the data at hand you really can’t draw that conclusion. All you can say with absolute certainty is that that joke is not funny here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Boy, it’s good to be back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How was your family?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, it was the worst trip, everyone got sick over the weekend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sick?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (running to opposite side of the room)
utterance.content: What kind of sick?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, the flu I guess.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t need you to guess, I need you to know, now when did the symptoms first appear?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Maybe Friday.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Friday, was that morning or afternoon?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I… I don’t…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Think woman, who blew their nose and when?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, relax, she doesn’t have any symptoms, I’m sure she’s not contagious.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh please, if influenza was only contagious after symptoms appear it would have died out thousands of years ago. Somewhere between tool using and cave painting, homo habilus would have figured out to kill the guy with the runny nose.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, you’ll have to excuse Sheldon, he’s a bit of a germophobe.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, it’s okay, I understand.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks for your consideration, now please leave.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’d better go before he starts spraying you with Lysol.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, thank you for getting my mail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No problem. Welcome home.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m making petrie dishes to grow throat cultures.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: With lime jello?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need a growth medium, and someone polished off the apricot yoghurt. Here, swab my throat.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard! If I’m going to get ahead of this thing I need to find out what’s growing in my throat.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you are not sick. This is, but you are not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We have no idea what pathogen Typhoid Penny has introduced into our environment. And having never been to Nebraska I’m fairly certain that I have no cornhusking antibodies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, don’t you think you’re overreacting?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When I’m lying comatose in a hospital relying on inferior minds to cure me, these jello cultures and my accompanying notes will give them a fighting chance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going back to bed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Put this in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need to measure my fluid intake and output to make sure my kidneys aren’t shutting down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I mix pancake batter in this!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, that measuring cup has always been for urine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You had time to make a label for everything in this apartment, including the label maker, but you didn’t have ten seconds to make one that said urine cup?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s right here on the bottom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Huh. I guess I owe the Betty Crocker company a letter of apology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear God. Leonard! Leonard, I’m sick!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice off)
utterance.content: Leonard! Leonard I’m sick!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering, wrapped in duvet)
utterance.content: Leonard! Leonard! Leonard. Leonard, my comforter fell down, and my sinuses hurt when I bend over. Leonard? Ow!

utterance.speaker: Leonard (voice on phone)
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, where are you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (running down stairs)
utterance.content: I’m at work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At six-thirty in the morning?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: On Sunday?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They asked me to come in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I didn’t hear the phone ring.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They texted me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, as I predicted, I am sick. My fever has been tracking up exponentially since 2am, and I am producing sputum at an alarming rate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No kidding?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Not only that, it has shifted from clear to milky green.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alright, well, get some rest and drink plenty of fluids.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What else would I drink? Gasses? Solids? Ionised plasma?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Drink whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want soup.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then make soup.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We don’t have soup.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m at work, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that a dog?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes,

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In the lab?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, they’re training dogs to operate the centrifuge for when they need dogs to operate the centrifuge for blind scientists, I have to go.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Howard, it’s the phone.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know it’s the phone, Ma, I hear the phone.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: Well who’s calling at this ungodly hour?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: Well ask them why they’re calling at this ungodly hour.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How can I ask them when I’m talking to you! Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, it’s Leonard, code Milky Green.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Dear Lord, not Milky Green!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Affirmative, with fever.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: Who’s on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: Why is he calling.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon’s sick.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: Were you playing with him?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: For God’s sake, Ma, I’m twenty six years old.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: Excuse me Mr Grown-up. Whadda-ya want for breakfast.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Chocolate milk and eggoes please!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, listen to me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on, call waiting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (voice)
utterance.content: No, don’t, don’t….

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, I’m sick.

utterance.speaker: Howard (imitating his mother’s voice)
utterance.content: Howard’s sleeping, this is his mother. Why are you calling at this ungodly hour?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need soup.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then call your own mother. It was Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I tried to stop you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s my own fault, I forgot the protocol we put in place after the great ear infection of ’06.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You call Koothrappali, we need to find a place to lay low for the next eighteen to twenty four hours.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stand by. Ma, can my friends come over?

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: I just had the carpets steamed.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s a negatory. But there’s a Planet of the Apes marathon at the New Art today.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Five movies, two hours apiece. It’s a start.

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: Homeless crazy guy at table eighteen.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, just crazy. Sheldon, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sick, thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How could you have gotten it from me, I’m not sick.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re a carrier. All these people here are doomed. You’re doomed!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shhh! Sheldon, what do you want.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want soup.

utterance.speaker: Penny (over Sheldon’s strange throat clearance)
utterance.content: Why didn’t you just…. Why didn’t you just have soup at home.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, I have an IQ of 187, don’t you imagine that if there were a way for me to have had soup at home I would have thought of it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You can have soup delivered.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I did not think of that. Clearly febrile delirium is setting in, please bring me some soup while I still understand what a spoon is for.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, what kind of soup do you want.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, my mother used to make me this split pea with little frankfurter slices and these home made croutons.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We have Chicken Tortilla and Potato Leek.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can I get any of those with little frankfurter slices and home made croutons?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then surprise me. Would you call that moss green or forest green?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look at this, everyone went chimp.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well I’d like to point out, I voted for orang-utan, but you shouted me down. .

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hi Penny!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, where are you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m… uh… at work.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You sound funny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m… uh… in a… I’m in a radiation suit. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well I’m at work too, and you’ll never guess who’s here infecting my entire station.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (To Howard and Raj)
utterance.content: Sheldon’s at the Cheesecake Factory. Just tell him to go home.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He won’t leave, he says he’s afraid he’ll pass out on the bus and someone will harvest his organs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (To Howard and Raj)
utterance.content: He’s paranoid, and he’s established a nest.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can you please come get him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I’d be… I’d be happy to Penny. Oh my God there’s a breech in the radiation unit The whole city is in jeopardy, oh my God, Professor Googenfeil is melting, gotta go, bye! I feel really guilty.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You did what you had to do.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Take your stinking paws off my popcorn you damn dirty ape.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks for bringing me home.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, it’s okay, I didn’t really need to work today, it’s not like I have rent or car payments or anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. Good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, you feel better.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, home, to write some bad cheques.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re going to leave me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, you are a grown man, haven’t you ever been sick before?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, of course, but, not by myself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really, never?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, once. When I was fifteen, and spending the summer at the Heidelberg Institute in Germany.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Studying abroad?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, visiting professor. Anyway, the local cuisine was a little more sausage-based than I’m used to, and the result was an internal blitzkrieg with my lower intestine playing the part of Czechoslovakia.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And there was no-one there to take care of you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. No, my mum had to fly back to Texas to help my dad because the house had slipped off the cinderblocks again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Again?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was tornado season. And it was an aluminium house. Anyway, the housekeeper in the faculty residence didn’t speak any English, when I finally managed to convince her I was sick, she said “Möchtest Du eine Darmspülung?”

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Based on what happened next, I assume it means “would you like an enema?”

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, sweetie, I’ll take care of you, what do you need?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, my mom used to give me sponge baths.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, ground rules, no sponge baths, and definitely no enemas.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Agreed.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here we go, ten and a half hours of apey goodness.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh dammit, my glasses. Okay, I’m blind here guys, can you help me find them?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry. Found ‘em.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry, don’t you have a spare.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, at home.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well if you leave now, you can be back before the gorillas rip the crap out of Charlton Heston.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Unless Sheldon’s there, in which case you’ll be trapped forever in his whiny hyper neurotic snot-web.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (Dials phone)
utterance.content: Hi, Penny. I was wondering, is Sheldon still at the restaurant? Okay, that was very nice of you. Okay, gotta go, got kind of a full blown Chernobyl thing here, gotta go, bye. He’s home, I’m screwed. Ten and a half hours of apey blurriness.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How about Lasic?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You want me to get eye surgery?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Would you rather go back to the apartment and deal with Sheldon, or have a stranger carve out your corneas with a laser beam?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m thinking!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, nice and cosy, okay, I’ll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Will you please rub this on my chest.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon, can’t you do that yourself?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Vaporub makes my hands smell funny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But Sheldon….

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, please, please, please, please, please, please.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe I’m doing this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, counter-clockwise or my chest hair mats.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can you sing “Soft Kitty”.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My mom used to sing it to me when I was sick.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry, honey, I don’t know it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll teach you. “Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur, happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr purr purr.” Now you.

utterance.speaker: Penny (after a loud sigh)
utterance.content: Soft kitty, warm kitty…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Little ball of fur. Keep rubbing.

utterance.speaker: Penny (through gritted teeth)
utterance.content: Little ball of fur.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you see, what do you see.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The living room appears to be empty.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, he must be in his bedroom. My spare glasses are in my bedroom, on my dresser, next to my Bat-signal.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not going in there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Raj?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No way, Jose.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well I can’t do it, I can’t see anything.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s all right, wireless mini-cam and Bluetooth headset. We’ll be your eyes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One more thing. This is a subsonic impact sensor. If Sheldon gets out of bed and starts to walk, this device will register it and send a signal to the laptop. At that point, based on the geography of the apartment and the ambulatory speed of a sick Sheldon, you’ll have seven seconds to get out, glasses or no glasses.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Won’t my footsteps set it off?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, you’ll be on your hands and knees. Now you’ll need to get the sensor as close as you can to Sheldon’s room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, how do I carry it if I’m on my hands and knees?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stay low. Bear left. Now keep true.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It means go straight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then just say go straight.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t stay go straight when you’re giving bearings, you say keep true.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alright I just hit my head.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Because you didn’t keep true. Okay, turn right.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The… the picture’s breaking up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Angle your head to the right. A little more. A little more. That’s it, now just keep true. Alright, you’re close enough to Sheldon’s room, deploy the sensor. Now turn it on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It wasn’t on?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then why did I have to crawl?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I guess you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, it’s on.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good. From this point forward you will have to crawl.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on, the sensor’s picking up something, turn your head back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You rat bastard.

utterance.speaker: Howard (running down stairs with Raj)
utterance.content: Told you the sensor would work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You deliberately stuck me with Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I had to, you see what he’s like.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Penny! Penny, I’m hungry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, it’s okay, sweetie, good news, Leonard’s home!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Penny (handing him vaporub)
utterance.content: Here you go, good luck, bye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: W-wait!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I’m hungry!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait! Penny! Take me with you!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want grilled cheese.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you think Penny will come here and take care of us?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think Penny’s ever coming here again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m very congested.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can you go to the kitchen, and get me the turkey baster labelled mucus.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If I stand, I’ll vomit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Under the sink, yellow Tupperware bowl.
